trans-unit.source: To add a shard for a new range or key
trans-unit.target: To add a shard for a new range or key

trans-unit.source: Applications often need to simply add new shards to handle data that is expected from new keys or key ranges, for a shard map that already exists.
trans-unit.target: Applications often need to simply add new shards to handle data that is expected from new keys or key ranges, for a shard map that already exists.

trans-unit.source: For example, an application sharded by Tenant ID may need to provision a new shard for a new tenant, or data sharded monthly may need a new shard provisioned before the start of each new month.
trans-unit.target: For example, an application sharded by Tenant ID may need to provision a new shard for a new tenant, or data sharded monthly may need a new shard provisioned before the start of each new month.

trans-unit.source: If the new range of key values is not already part of an existing mapping, it is very simple to add the new shard and associate the new key or range to that shard.
trans-unit.target: If the new range of key values is not already part of an existing mapping, it is very simple to add the new shard and associate the new key or range to that shard.

trans-unit.source: To add a shard for an empty part of an existing range
trans-unit.target: To add a shard for an empty part of an existing range

trans-unit.source: In some circumstances, you may have already mapped a range to a shard and partially filled it with data, but you now want upcoming data to be directed to a different shard.
trans-unit.target: In some circumstances, you may have already mapped a range to a shard and partially filled it with data, but you now want upcoming data to be directed to a different shard.

trans-unit.source: For example, you shard by day range and have already allocated 50 days to a shard, but on day 24, you want future data to land in a different shard.
trans-unit.target: For example, you shard by day range and have already allocated 50 days to a shard, but on day 24, you want future data to land in a different shard.

trans-unit.source: The elastic database <link><linkText>split-merge tool</linkText><title></title></link> can perform this operation, but if data movement is not necessary (for example, data for the range of days [25, 50), i.e., day 25 inclusive to 50 exclusive, does not yet exist) you can perform this entirely using the Shard Map Management APIs directly.
trans-unit.target: The elastic database <link><linkText>split-merge tool</linkText><title></title></link> can perform this operation, but if data movement is not necessary (for example, data for the range of days [25, 50), i.e., day 25 inclusive to 50 exclusive, does not yet exist) you can perform this entirely using the Shard Map Management APIs directly.
